game

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.Game
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.json.JSONString

    public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
implements org.json.JSONString
    The Game Class is the controlling class for the ShippingGame Project. Each game contains a collection of Parcels that need to be delivered from their starting Node to their desired destination node. In order to do this, each game also has a collection of Trucks that are able to pick up and move Parcels along edges between nodes.

    Games also contain an instance of a Map that holds all of the Nodes and Edges in this game. The manager may use this map to determine where trucks should go and what edges should be used to get there.

    Finally, each Game contains a Score object, that manages the points in the Game and holds the current value when the final score is announced
    Author:
    MPatashnik

        public void setGameSpeed(int s)
                  throws java.lang.RuntimeException

        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException

      • start

        public void start()
        Starts the game by having each truck begin running, then having the manager begin running. Make sure not to do this twice.

      • writeGame

        public void writeGame(java.lang.String fileName)
               throws java.io.IOException,
                      java.lang.RuntimeException
        Writes this Game to a text file that can be loaded and re-played later. Can only be used if the game has not yet started or finished. If either of these is true, throws a runtime exception
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if the game is not in its pre-start state when this method is called
